p: SARS-CoV-2 belongs to the βCoV genera of the Coronavirinae subfamily of the order of Nidovirals [ 3]. Compared to SARS and MERS—coronavirus strains that caused the two most recent epidemics, in 2002–2003 and 2012, respectively—it mostly resembles SARS-CoV-1 (2002–03), with 79.5% sequence identity and the same mechanism for host cell entrance, via the angiotensin-converting enzyme-2 (ACE-2) surface protein of the cell [ 4].
